definition:
Suppose $\Omega$ is a domain of ${\mathbb{R}}^n$ and $\partial\Omega$ is
the boundary of $\Omega$. Further suppose $f$ is a function
$f\colon\partial \Omega\to{\mathbb{C}}$. Then the *Dirichlet problem* is
to find a function
$\phi\colon \Omega\cup \partial \Omega \to{\mathbb{C}}$ such that
$$\begin{aligned}
\phi &=& f,\quad \text{on $\partial \Omega$}, \\
\nabla^2 \phi &=& 0,\quad \text{in $\Omega$}. \end{aligned}$$
